Serialized Form

  • Package Background

    • Class Background.Background

      class Background extends JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • checkCollision
          CheckCollision checkCollision
          Handles collision detection for walls and objects.
        • enemy1
          EnemySlug enemy1
          An enemy of type EnemySlug that actively chases the player.
        • enemy2
          EnemyRock enemy2
          An enemy of type EnemyRock with random movement.
        • enemy3
          EnemyMush enemy3
          An enemy of type EnemyMush with different behavior.
        • enemy4
          EnemyDragon enemy4
          A more powerful enemy called EnemyDragon.
        • eslugCollision
          EnemyCollision eslugCollision
          Handles collision detection specifically for enemies.
        • finished
          boolean finished
          a Boolean that is used to stop the game and display victory
        • frame
          FreeBomber frame
          Reference to the main frame that contains this panel.
        • gameOver
          boolean gameOver
          Flag indicating whether the game is over.
        • gameThread
          Thread gameThread
          Thread used to run the main game loop.
        • heartImage
          BufferedImage heartImage
          Image used to display player's health (hearts).
        • keyHandler
          KeyHandler keyHandler
          Captures and processes keyboard input.
        • player
          JackBomber player
          The main player character (JackBomber).
        • screenCols
          int screenCols
          Number of horizontal tiles on the screen.
        • screenHeight
          int screenHeight
          Total screen height in pixels, calculated from tile size and rows.
        • screenRows
          int screenRows
          Number of vertical tiles on the screen.
        • screenWidth
          int screenWidth
          Total screen width in pixels, calculated from tile size and columns.
        • tileManager
          TileManager tileManager
          Manages and renders tile maps.
        • tileSize
          int tileSize
          Size of a single tile in pixels.

    • Class Background.GameOverPanel

      class GameOverPanel extends JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • backg
          Background backg
          Temporary background instance used to fetch screen size for panel layout.
        • menuGameButton
          JButton menuGameButton
          Button that returns the player to the main menu screen.
        • restartGameButton
          JButton restartGameButton
          Button that allows the player to restart the game from the beginning.

    • Class Background.HighscorePanel

      class HighscorePanel extends JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • backButton
          JButton backButton
          Button used to return from the high score panel to the main menu.
        • backg
          Background backg
          Reference to a background object for screen dimension access.
        • scoreboardData
          Map<String,Integer> scoreboardData
          Internal storage of scoreboard entries mapped from player name to score.
        • scoreTable
          JTable scoreTable
          JTable component used to visually display the scoreboard.
        • tableModel
          DefaultTableModel tableModel
          Table model backing the scoreTable, used to store and update score rows.

    • Class Background.MenuPanel

      class MenuPanel extends JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • bg
          Background bg
          Background instance used to get screen dimension settings.
        • currentUsername
          String currentUsername
          Stores the username entered by the player.
        • exitButton
          JButton exitButton
          Button to exit the game application.
        • highScoreButton
          JButton highScoreButton
          Button that navigates to the high score display panel.
        • newGameButton
          JButton newGameButton
          Button to initiate a new game session after username input.
        • ruleButton
          JButton ruleButton
          Button to for displaying the rules

    • Class Background.RulePanel

      class RulePanel extends JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • backButton
          JButton backButton
          Button to return from the rules panel to the main menu.
        • backg
          Background backg
          Background object to get screen dimensions.
        • rulesTextArea
          JTextArea rulesTextArea
          Text area for displaying game rules to the player.
        • scoreboardData
          Map<String,Integer> scoreboardData
          Map for scoreboard data; not used in this panel currently.

    • Class Background.YouWonPanel

      class YouWonPanel extends JPanel implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • backg
          Background backg
          Reference background used to fetch screen dimensions
        • menuGameButton
          JButton menuGameButton
          Starts a completely new game session

  • Package FreeBomber

    • Class FreeBomber.FreeBomber

      class FreeBomber extends JFrame implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • background
          Background background
          Reference to the active game canvas (Background).
        • gameOverPanel
          GameOverPanel gameOverPanel
          Reference to the panel shown when the player loses the game.
        • highscorePanel
          HighscorePanel highscorePanel
          Reference to the high score display panel.
        • menuPanel
          MenuPanel menuPanel
          Reference to the main menu panel.
        • playerName
          String playerName
          The player's name displayed in high scores and menus.
        • playerScore
          int playerScore
          Stores the current game score for the player.
        • rulePanel
          RulePanel rulePanel
          Reference to the Rule Panel
        • startingMap
          int startingMap
          The map number to start the game from. Used for cheat mode or custom level starts.
        • victory
          YouWonPanel victory
          Panel shown upon player victory.
